document.masterDocTitle: A new species and new country records for the genus Leptobium Casey in the Palaearctic Region (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and new country records for the genus Leptobium Casey in the Palaearctic Region (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material: ALGERIA :
1♂ , Algerie , Yakouren ( MHNG ); 1♂ , Algerie ,
Alger
( MHNG );
GREECE :
1♀ , “Graecia”, coll. Leder & Reitter ( NMPC ).
IRAN
: 5♂ , 7♀ , 9–10.IV.1973 , SE Iran , 25 km W Ghasre-ghand ( NMPC ).
IRAQ :
2♂ , 1♀ , 19.V.2008 , northern Iraq , ca 6 km NW Suleimaniyah province, by light traps ( AZMM ).
MOROCCO :
1♂ , Morocco , Jetouan, Chechaouen ( MHNG ). SLOVAKIA : 2♂ , 2♀ , 13.XII.1959 , Košice region, Trebišov district, Leles ( NMPC ). 2♂ , 1♀ , 23.V.1936 , Štúrovo (=Parkan) ( NMPC ). 1♀ , 2.VII.1932 , Chľaba (=Helemba) ( NMPC ). SPAIN : 1♂ , Spanien , coll. Hlisnikovský ( NMPC ).
TURKEY :

DiStribution:
L. gracile
is a widespread species in the Palaearctic region. This species is known from Canary Islands to Middle Asia ( Assing, 2005 , 2010a ; Schülke & Smetana, 2015 ).
L. gracile
is here recorded from Iraq for the first time.
